nodes.bodyText:
Driving by but is it necessary to add this intermediate object? I think the interface we had, getCountByStatusMap(), works well. We just need to change the implementation to speed it up.
The computeProjectCountByStatus2() call below should work and that gets us most of the way there. All getCountByStatusMap() would have to do is convert the result from computeProjectCountByStatus2() to match the existing interface.

That was a guess based on. the debugger output when it tried to convert internally.
I don't know how to capture the query result safely without a new POJO or entity. Like, that's what I'm supposed to get from. packages. like this I thought. If I'm having to. cast from. object and then. manually call a constructor with parameters the same names as my columns, then. I want to shop for another framework.  Ideally I could just make an Immutable for it.
But if that works, it should help.

oo, this is neat! thanks @freemabd
Also, another comment, I think its best to avoid using native queries where possible. Native queries will run the query as is against the underlying database. This would be OK if we used the same database everywhere but I believe our tests use some in memory database (H2?).
I have had issues where native queries work in production and fail in tests and vice versa.
Writing HQL will let hibernate figure out the right way to generate the query based on what database is currently in use. Caveat is that you don't have access to all the SQL tools that MySQL provides but HQL should suffice for most cases.
Great points. Was going to try going up a level. in abstraction after getting something working. It'll be good to start a set of Hibernate, SQL, and data model guidelines.
Projection interface works! Much nicer. No annotatitons even.
One way around this ugliness is a persisted, computed column. Not worth it here, as much as I hate seeing this comparison to null everywhere to essentially build a boolean.
Unfortunate, but glad that you were able to get this working.
Shouldn't this test really be in BillingProjectBufferEntryDaoTest? Doesn't seem to test anything in the service layer.
Can we write a test case for this in WorkspaceDaoTest?
Can we write a test class for UserDaoTest and test all methods?
Yep. This is my first Dao Test, and the only thing that's tricky is understanding when my autowired dao is cleared between tests.
Can we write a test class for this in DataSetDaoTest and test all the methods?
For scope reasons,  I'm going to just. cover the methods added here for now.
Can we write a test class for this in BillingProjectBufferEntryDaoTest and test all the methods?
